item.title: Best Hytale Mods You Need To Download
item.content:encoded:
Modding is a huge part of gaming, and instead of concentrating on the default content, Hypixel Studios encourages the community to download and install the best Hytale mods to make the game even more wild.

Some games actively discourage modding and do their best to avoid having the base game assets be manipulated in any way. Hytale is the complete polar opposite. Hytale wants you to mod, it wants you to create mods; whatever funky ideas are flowing around in your brainwaves need to be used to create fun and original content.

If you’re looking to mess around with Hytale and implement the best mods to make the game easier, better, or even more entertaining, this guide has you covered.

8 Top Hytale Mods To Install

Hytale has partnered up with CurseForge to deliver official mods. The game’s long-awaited launch was accompanied by well over 80 mods to download and install. Insider Gaming has picked out our favorite ones so far, and keep checking back as the list is updated with new mods to add.

Advanced Item Info

This is comfortably one of the most (if not the most) downloaded Hytale mods—and for obvious reasons. It tells you much more information about the items and materials you pick up. There’s a certain level of ambiguity when it comes to survival games about the resources you collect, leaving it up to you to decide what they’re for, or discover their main purpose(s). This mod eliminates a lot of the mystery and gets straight to the point.

Download the Advanced Item Info mod here.

Ymmersive Foliage

Hypixel Studios and founder Simon Collins-Laflamme have been hard on themselves at times in the build-up to launch. It’s in early access, and the team has said that it needs a lot of work. It’s probably true, but the game’s early access launch looked spectacular. However, if you want to spruce and juice up the environment with extra color, depth, and detail, the Ymmersive Foliage mode does that in Hytale.

Download the Ymmersive Foliage mod here.

Lucky Mining

A good way to think about this mod is like hacking away at a material in Fortnite. You get rewarded for consecutive good hits, and it’s kind of the same here. If you keep mining the same material in a row—Ores, in this case—you get more of it. It can make the grind easier, and stock up your inventory with enough Ore to start a new country.

Download the Lucky Mining mod here.

YUNG’s HyDungeons

This mod might not be for beginners, but if you fancy a devious dungeon-based challenge and upgrade, consider checking out the YUNG’s HyDungeons mod. It adds new dungeons with “procedurally generated dungeon instances.” You do need to hit 100 Memories first, but there will come a point where you can enjoy this fabulous mod.

Download the YUNG’s HyDungeons mod here.

Thorium Furnaces

Sometimes, a good quality-of-life feature can go a long way. It doesn’t have to be a wild mod that breaks the game. The Thorium Furnaces mode adds 11 new furnaces, and they speed up the smelting process, saving a lot of time. The rarer the furnace, the faster it gets the job done, allowing you to go exploring quicker.

Download the Thorium Furnaces mod here.

Wan’s Wonder Weapons

If you are after a wild mod that is just plain fun, look no further than Wan’s Wonder Weapons. When you think of ‘Wonder Weapons,’ you might think of Call of Duty’s Ray Gun, but here, you get special weapons like the Maelstrom anchor, Frostburn sword, or Chromatic Cleaver—the final one looking like it was pulled straight from a unicorn. If a pickaxe or regular sword just isn’t cutting it, download and get yourself Wan’s Wonder Weapons.

Download the Wan’s Wonder Weapons mod here.

Ymmersive Melodies

You can “Annoy your friends with custom melodies” using the Ymmersive Melodies mod in Hytale. Does more need to be said? If you’re playing with friends in Hytale, why wouldn’t you want to upload custom melodies to make them want to throw Wild Berries or Dark Feathers at you?

Download the Ymmersive Melodies mod here.

Wayback Charm

As we come to the home stretch, it makes sense to end with a mod that aptly takes you home. CurseForge says this about the mod: “The Wayback Charm is a magical tool that can help you find your way back home. Simply press the use key (F) while holding the charm, and you will be teleported to the nearest respawn point. Respawn points can be created using blocks like beds. If you do not have a respawn location, or the respawn location is considered invalid, you will be sent to the world spawn.” Sounds good, right?

Download the Wayback Charm mod here.

Have your say on Hytale modding. Have you found any must-have lists that have been left off this list? If so, head to the Insider Gaming Discord Server and let the staff know, as the mod might end up on this list!

Don’t go anywhere, there are plenty of other Hytale guides to check out: How to get Light Hide, How to enable PvP, and Does Hytale have Controller Support.

item.title: Meta Closes Multiple Studios, Lays Off Staff
item.content:encoded:
Meta is scaling back its gaming presence with a round of layoffs. A report on Monday from the New York Times said that the company was set to let go roughly 10% of staff from the Reality Labs side of the company.

One day later, and it appears that those layoffs have begun with a number of studios being hit.

Reality Labs, if you didn’t know, houses Meta’s Oculus Studios division. Oculus Studios is responsible for managing the various first party studios and teams that develop games for the Meta Quest VR headsets.

Two studios known to be impacted by the layoffs are Twisted Pixel Games and Sanzaru Games. In a post on Twitter, designer Andy Gentile revealed that he had been let go. In his post, Gentile added that “It appears the entire Twisted Pixel games studio has been shut down. Sanzaru Games too.”

Over on LinkedIn, Sanzaru senior level designer Ray West also confirmed that Sanzaru, along with “several Meta game studios” were shut down.

“It was an amazing team of powerhouse talent, and I’m really glad to have gotten to know everyone there,” he said.

Prior to the layoffs and studio closures, Twisted Pixel Games recently released Deadpool VR for Meta Quest 3. For Sanzaru, they developed the highly regarded Asgard’s Wrath and Asgard’s Wrath 2.

Insider Gaming has reached out to Meta for comment on how many jobs were lost and all of the studios hit as part of these layoffs. Should a response be received, it will be added to this story.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1670: Hints and Answer for January 14, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1670 for January 14, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, January 14, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1670 should be easy for most players. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 3 of 6 guesses. That makes it nearly two guesses easier than the 4.8-guess average from January 13.

General Wordle Hints For January 14

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is almost always used as a verb, not a noun.
  • Hint 2: It commonly appears in advice, warnings, or instructions.
  • Hint 3: The action it describes is usually intentional, not accidental.
  • Hint 4: You’ll often see this word paired with things people want to stay away from rather than confront.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1670 for January 14, 2026.

Starter Words For January 14, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • VALID
  • VIDEO
  • AUDIO
  • DIVOT

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1670 On January 14, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: AVOID

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

AVOID is a verb that means “to keep away from; keep clear of; shun.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1669 on January 13, 2026

Answer: GUMBO

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1670?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on January 15 will be Wordle Game #1671.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: CS2 Transfer Market ‘Out of Control’, apEX Declares
item.content:encoded:
Vitality’s award-winning IGL, Dan ‘apEX’ Madesclaire, has voiced strong concerns about the state of the Counter-Strike 2 transfer market. He has argued that the current pricing climate has made roster changes (especially meaningful ones) almost impossible for most organizations in the space.

In the wake of the HLTV Award Show, during which apEX secured an award for IGL of the Year, he suggested that even the biggest organizations in Counter-Strike are being priced out of making key moves.

What’s Wrong with the Counter-Strike Market?

According to apEX, the financial expectations around player buyouts have reached a critical point. Even well-funded organizations can’t engage, and teams that want to ‘shake things up’ simply can’t. They’re backing off because quotes are ‘completely unrealistic’.

He also stated that the Counter-Strike esports ecosystem doesn’t generate enough revenue to justify skyrocketing buyout demands that have surged in the last year.

Here’s the full quote:

So many teams wanted to make a change, I guess, but they couldn’t. The transfer market is crazy. The prices are “What the f**k is going on?” In CS, we don’t make enough money to make changes, all those prizes are crazy. That’s why we hear nothing from NAVI, no MOUZ as well, who wanted to shuffle, I’m pretty sure.

(Thanks to Escore for the quote)

ApEX explained that the quiet offseason and the lack of transfers can be attributed specifically to this issue.

The looming shadow over the market remains Team Falcons, the Saudi-backed organization that has the largest coffers in the esports world. In the last few years, the company has soared in the competitive gaming space, buying out killer squads in multiple games.

But even Team Falcons neglected to make any changes during the winter freeze. If Team Falcons is hesitating, then the pricing issue must be extreme.

ApEX’s comments reflect the growing concern amongst players that the CS2 transfer market is overheating. If buyout quotes continue to rise faster than team revenues do on a comparative scale, the top organizations willbe forced to delay or abandon roster plans and rebuilds.

item.title: EA Delays Start Of Battlefield 6 Season 2
item.content:encoded:
EA has announced that it is delaying the start of Battlefield 6 Season 2.

In a post on the game’s official subreddit, EA revealed that Season 2 for both Battlefield 6 and Battlefield REDSEC will now start on February 17. Originally, the next season was expected to begin on January 21.

“During our ongoing development, we’ve continued to review community feedback and, in order to keep our promise, determined that our best path forward is to extend Season 1 and give ourselves extra time to further polish and refine Season 2,” EA said in their statement.

They continued: “Season 1 will be extended past its in-game end date of January 20, and we will launch Season 2 on February 17. The Season 1 extension update to Battlefield 6 and REDSEC will be released on January 20, which will include new weekly challenges, a Bonus Path, and a continuation of the Season 1 Battle Pass until the start date of Season 2.“

With this delay, EA is giving players a new “Frostfire Bonus Path” starting on January 27. This new path includes new customization rewards along with XP boosts. Free rewards from the path include Hardware XP Boost, a Vehicle Skin and player card customization items. Those with the Battle Pass can get a new weapon package and career XP boost.

“Unlike previous Bonus Paths, all Bonus Path Points for the Frostfire Bonus Path are earned through Weekly Challenges; there are no Bonus Challenges associated with this Bonus Path.,” EA says.

item.title: Six Invitational 2026—Teams, Schedule, and Where to Watch
item.content:encoded:
The Six Invitational 2026 is fast approaching, and it’s a sure staple in the calendar of any Rainbow Six esports fan. This is the biggest event in the book for Rainbow Six Siege, boasting a massive $3 million prize pool. It’s the pinnacle of the scene, and in this guide, we’re breaking down everything you need to know about the Six Invitational 2026.

If you’re wondering which teams have qualified for the Six Invitational or what the Six Invitational schedule is looking like, go no further than this guide. Read on to have your questions answered.

Six Invitational 2026 Schedule and Location

The Six Invitational 2026 will take place in Paris at the Adidas Arena. This echoes the 2021 event, which also took place in Paris, France. It’s expected to be one of the most monumental Six Invitational events in history, and it might challenge the stature of the Six Invitational 2024, which was a record-breaking event held in São Paulo, Brazil.

Here’s the Six Invitational 2026 schedule and format:

Group Stage

All 20 teams come together for the group stage, falling into batches of five teams apiece. At this stage, all matches played are best-of-three.

This stage runs from February 2 to February 6 and will be behind closed doors, exclusively available to watch online.

The first-placed team from each group will qualify for round two of the playoffs, while the second- and third-placed teams will advance to round one. The fourth-placed teams go into the lower bracket of the playoffs, while the bottom team in each group is eliminated from the tournament.

Playoffs – Round One

The first round of the playoffs will be a behind-closed-doors event, held between February 8 and February 10.

Playoffs – Round Two

The second round of the playoffs will run from February 13 to February 15 and will be played in front of a live audience in the Adidas Arena.

The playoffs will feature a double-elimination bracket with best-of-three match formats (except for the grand final, which is best-of-five).

Six Invitational 2026 Teams

Here is the full list of the teams qualified to compete in the Six Invitational 2026.

  • M80
  • Team Falcons
  • FaZe Clan
  • Spacestation Gaming
  • Weibo Gaming
  • FURIA

  • Shopify Rebellion

Where to Watch Six Invitational 2026

If you want to take part in some Rainbow Six betting or perhaps you just want to watch the action unfold, you’ll need to know which platforms to visit. Here are the best options for watching the Six Invitational 2026 live:

  • Rainbow Six on Twitch
  • Rainbow Six on YouTube
  • Rainbow Six BR on Twitch
  • Rainbow Six ES on Twitch
  • Rainbow Six FR on Twitch
